contacts-screen.header.headline: Manage contacts
contacts-screen.modals.import-contacts.t: Import your contacts so that you can start right away. All your contacts are stored locally. No data is tracked or shared.
day-screen.header.headline: Daily overview
day-screen.contacts.empty: You have not added any contacts for this day.
day-screen.locations.empty: You haven‚Äôt added any locations for this day.
export-screen.header.headline: Export
export-screen.content.section-1.headline: Your overview
export-screen.content.section-1.text: Collectively we can reconstruct paths of infection by informing health authorities and the people around you.
export-screen.content.section-2.headline: With big power comes big responsibility
export-screen.content.section-2.text: Keep in mind that the data is very sensitive. We highly recommend to not share it online or with random people.
policy-screen.header.headline: Policy
policy-screen.content.section-1.headline: Containing the spread of the virus together
policy-screen.content.section-1.text: By tracing the paths of infection we can limit further spread of COVID-19.
policy-screen.content.section-2.headline: Your data is yours alone
policy-screen.content.section-2.text: All data created and used by Coronika is stored locally and will not be tracked or passed on.
tips.avoid-crowds-of-people.headline: Avoid crowds of people
tips.avoid-crowds-of-people.text: If possible, avoid going on trips, using public transport and instead work from home. In general, any contacts should be reduced to the essentials and the attendance of events with crowds of people should be avoided. Citizens who are older than 60 years of age should obtain a vaccine against pneumococcal infection.
tips.avoid-crowds-of-people.list.item-1: staying at home when you are unwell
tips.avoid-crowds-of-people.list.item-2: avoiding large public gatherings if they‚Äôre not essential
tips.avoid-crowds-of-people.list.item-3: keeping a distance of 2 metres between you and other people whenever possible
tips.avoid-crowds-of-people.list.item-4: covering your coughs and sneezes with your elbow or a tissue
tips.avoid-crowds-of-people.list.item-5: minimising physical contact, especially with people at higher risk such as older people and people with existing health conditions
tips-screen.header.headline: Hygiene tips
tips.washing-hands.headline: Washing your hands
tips.washing-hands.text: Washing your hands is easy, and it‚Äôs one of the most effective ways to prevent the spread of germs. Clean hands can stop germs from spreading. Follow these five steps every time:
tips.washing-hands.list.item-1: Wet your hands with clean, running water (warm or cold), turn off the tap, and apply soap.
tips.washing-hands.list.item-2: Lather your hands by rubbing them together with the soap. Lather the backs of your hands, between your fingers, and under your nails.
tips.washing-hands.list.item-3: Scrub your hands for at least 20 seconds. Need a timer? Hum the ‚ÄúHappy Birthday‚Äù song from beginning to end twice.
tips.washing-hands.list.item-4: Rinse your hands well under clean, running water.
tips.washing-hands.list.item-5: Dry your hands using a clean towel or air dry them.
tips.mouthguard.headline: Mouthguard, yes or no?
tips.coughing-sneezing.headline: Proper coughing and sneezing
tips.not-feeling-well.headline: I don't feel well, do I have the virus?
tips.am-i-infected.headline: I'm afraid I got the coronavirus, what can I do?
tips.reliable-sources.headline: Where can I find reliable sources?
tips-screen.intro.text: Here you find knowledge that is helping you to reduce the risk of infection as much as possible and to do the right thing in case of an infection.
welcome-screen.slides.intro.headline: Fighting corona-virus together
welcome-screen.slides.intro.text: Log contacts and locations, reconstruct paths of infection and help stopping the spread.
welcome-screen.slides.intro.button: Great, I want to help, too
welcome-screen.slides.how-to.headline: A diary for our collective health
welcome-screen.slides.how-to.text: Write down who you have met, the public places you have visited and make a contribution to the health of everyone.
welcome-screen.slides.local-data.text: All data created and used by Coronika is stored locally and will not be tracked or passed on.
